snippet: When Google included smaller Web sites in the fees it charges to incorporate its maps online, many of them rebelled.
abstract: Google Maps is the dominant player in the world of street maps, satellite photos and street-level views; its new policy of charging smaller Web sites fees when their users start generating an average of 25,000 map views daily is causing many sites to rebel; 52 million people accessed maps on their smartphones in January, up 67 percent from year earlier.

headline.main: Facing Fees, Some Sites Are Bypassing Google Maps
headline.print_headline: Facing Fees, Some Sites Are Bypassing Google Maps

snippet: Viewers express interest in the latest Cartier commercial in all its versions.

snippet: In “The Idea Factory,” Jon Gertner profiles Bell Labs in its heyday and the scientists whose unhurried pursuit of pure research led it to innovations that define modern life.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book The Idea Factory: Bell Labs and the Great Age of American Innovation by Jon Gertner.

headline.main: What Hath Bell Labs Wrought? The Future
headline.print_headline: What Hath Bell Labs Wrought? The Future

snippet: This spring, the jewelry designer Alexandra Moosally is adding produce to her selection of whimsical gold and pavé pieces.

headline.main: The Get | Alexandra Moosally's Carrot Necklace

snippet: Apple said it had already sold more than three million new iPads during its first weekend on the market, including preorders. That's triple the number of iPad 2 tablets that analysts estimated the company sold during that product's opening weekend...
abstract: Apple said it had already sold more than three million new iPads during its first weekend on the market, including preorders. That's triple the number of iPad 2 tablets that analysts estimated the company sold during that product's opening weekend last year.

headline.main: Apple Sells 3 Million New iPads in First Weekend

snippet: The ruling by a New Zealand judge leaves open the possibility that millions in assets could be returned to Megaupload's founder, Kim Dotcom. Also, StubHub opens in Britain and the Beatles arrive on digital jukeboxes.
abstract: The ruling by a New Zealand judge leaves open the possibility that millions in assets could be returned to Megaupload's founder, Kim Dotcom. Also, StubHub opens in Britain and the Beatles arrive on digital jukeboxes.

headline.main: Digital Notes: Judge Sides With Megaupload Over Police Raid

snippet: The decision by the public-radio show "This American Life" to retract an episode on the factories in China that make Apple devices exposed the differences between theater and journalism.
abstract: The decision by the public-radio show "This American Life" to retract an episode on the factories in China that make Apple devices exposed the differences between theater and journalism.

headline.main: Carr and Stelter on a Retraction by 'This American Life'

snippet: Some small changes are made, and a new prologue added to "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs."
